ai-ja472:2.4_0: like a blind man on a flame.
ai-ja472:3.1_0: who punishes those who are harmless,
ai-ja472:3.2_0: he who punishes those who are harmless,
ai-ja472:3.3_0: like a blind man on the path.
ai-ja472:4.1_0: The one who sees these things
ai-ja472:4.4_0: is worthy of going on you.
ai-ja472:5.4_0: That’s why you should live in both places.
ai-ja472:6.3_0: But having understood both of these,
ai-ja472:6.4_0: and you should do the same.
ai-ja472:8.4_0: go and wait upon the path!”
ai-ja472:9.3_0: in the morning time, in the evening,
ai-ja472:10.2_0: We shall go to a mountain cave,
ai-ja472:11.2_0: the King’s son, going to his own home,
ai-ja472:11.3_0: as king of kings, lord of men!
ai-ja472:12.3_0: after removing his filth from pleasure.
ai-ja472:12.4_0: so I see my own self.”
ai-ja472:13.1_0: “What do you call someone ever to you?
ai-ja472:13.2_0: What do you call ever blood?
ai-ja472:13.3_0: Why do you call someone a sewer?
ai-ja472:14.3_0: I declare you one who is guarded,
ai-ja472:14.4_0: Know that for a noble disciple.”
ai-ja472:15.1_0: “For a long time I’ve seen my mother,
ai-ja472:15.5_0: I was the son of King Pasenadi,
ai-ja472:15.6_0: That’s how you should bear it.”
ai-ja472:16.1_0: Mahāpadassana was born again and again.
